dmca.title: [TP-C468829L] Client Abuse Complaint - Copyright Infringement
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal. Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Tuesday, August 15, 2006 4:43 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [TP-C468829L] Client Abuse Complaint - Copyright Infringement Subject: [TP-C468829L] Client Abuse Complaint - Copyright Infringement From: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: [TP-C468829L] Client Abuse Complaint - Copyright Infringement Reference: [TP-C468829L] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. Client Abuse Complaint - Copyright Infringement Added by system at Monday, Aug 14 2006 10:03 pm X-MailFrom: oldiesmann@simplemachines.org X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.180] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Mon Aug 14 22:02:20 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Mon, 14 Aug 2006 22:02:19 -0500 Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.111]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from oldiesmann@simplemachines.org) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GCpC7-000J40-7m for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Mon, 14 Aug 2006 22:02:19 -0500 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Mon, 14 Aug 2006 22:02:18 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from oldiesmann@simplemachines.org) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GCpC6-00004R-Q2 for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 14 Aug 2006 22:02:18 -0500 Received: from zeal.simplemachinesweb.com ([69.72.214.162] helo=simplemachines.org) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from oldiesmann@simplemachines.org) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GCpC6-000Jwh-51 for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 14 Aug 2006 22:02:18 -0500 Received: from cpe-65-27-145-121.cinci.res.rr.com ([65.27.145.121] helo=[127.0.0.1]) by simplemachines.org with esmtpa (Exim 4.52) id 1GCpC3-0000lu-5E for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 14 Aug 2006 23:02:15 -0400 Message-ID: <44E13928.2040304@simplemachines.org> Date: Mon, 14 Aug 2006 23:02:00 -0400 From: "Michael \"Oldiesmann\" Eshom" Organization: Simple Machines User-Agent: Thunderbird 1.5.0.5 (Windows/20060719) MIME-Version: 1.0 To: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: Client Abuse Complaint - Copyright Infringement Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="------------060604080401080400020306" X-AntiAbuse: This header was added to track abuse, please include it with any abuse report X-AntiAbuse: Primary Hostname - simplemachines.org X-AntiAbuse: Original Domain - theplanet.com X-AntiAbuse: Originator/Caller UID/GID - [47 12] / [47 12] X-AntiAbuse: Sender Address Domain - simplemachines.org X-Source: X-Source-Args: X-Source-Dir: Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 69.72.214.162 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of simplemachines.org) client-ip=69.72.214.162; envelope-from=oldiesmann@simplemachines.org; helo=simplemachines.org; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 15 Aug 2006 03:02:18.0679 (UTC) FILETIME=[383AB470:01C6C017] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) On Saturday, I emailed Kevin Olson ("acidjazz" is his username on his forum) informing him that running a copy of our software with no visible copyright notice was a violation of our license, and informing him what his options were. The following is the original mesasge I sent to him, along with his reply. Normally we would contact the host, but because he also owns the domain where the site is being hosted, we have no choice but to contact you. The forum in question is at http://www.slickpost.com/forum/index.php A full copy of our license can be viewed at http://www.simplemachines.org/about/license.php -------- Original Message -------- Subject: Re: Simple Machines Forum License Violation - Copyright Removal Date: Mon, 14 Aug 2006 02:44:37 -0700 From: acidjazz To: Michael Oldiesmann Eshom References: <44DDD451.3060303@simplemachines.org> lol On 8/12/06, Michael Oldiesmann Eshom wrote: > > Dear acidjazz: > > It has come to our attention that you are running a copy of SMF with > no visible copyright notice (other than your own). This is a violation > of the license that is included with every copy of SMF, and is therefore illegal. > > As stated in the license: > > 1. Permission is hereby granted to use, copy, modify and/or > distribute this Package, provided that: > > a. All copyright notices within source files and as generated by > the Software as output are retained, unchanged. > > 2.You may make Modifications to this Package or a derivative of it, > and distribute your Modifications in a form that is separate from the > Package, such as patches. The following restrictions apply to Modifications: > > a. A Modification must not alter or remove any copyright notices > in the Software or Package, generated or otherwise. > > You must now either undo these changes, restoring the original > copyright text or remove all copies of SMF from your server within 48 > hours. The license has already expired, as per section 5: > > 5. This Agreement will terminate automatically if you fail to comply > with the limitations described herein. > > Failure to comply with this notice will result in us contacting your > host and/or other providers to inform them of your illegal activities, > and may require us to involve our lawyers. > > If you have any questions regarding this notice or the license, > please contact me or any other team member. The full text of the > license may be viewed at > http://www.simplemachines.org/about/license.php > > -- > > > Michael "Oldiesmann" Eshom > Support Specialist > Simple Machines -- -kevin -- Michael "Oldiesmann" Eshom Support Specialist Simple Machines MIME element (text/html) On Saturday, I emailed Kevin Olson ("acidjazz" is his username on his forum) informing him that running a copy of our software with no visible copyright notice was a violation of our license, and informing him what his options were. The following is the original mesasge I sent to him, along with his reply.

Normally we would contact the host, but because he also owns the domain where the site is being hosted, we have no choice but to contact you.

The forum in question is at http://www.slickpost.com /forum/index.php

A full copy of our license can be viewed at http://www.simple machines.org/about/license.php

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: Re: Simple Machines Forum License Violation - Copyright Removal
Date: Mon, 14 Aug 2006 02:44:37 -0700
From: acidjazz <acidjazz@gmail.com>
To: Michael Oldiesmann Eshom <oldiesmann@simplemachine s.org>
References: <44DDD451.3060303@s implemachines.org> 


lol 
 
On 8/12/06, Michael Oldiesmann Eshom <oldiesmann@simplemachine
s.org> wrote: 
> 
>  Dear acidjazz: 
> 
>  It has come to our attention that you are running a copy of SMF
with no 
> visible copyright notice (other than your own). This is a violation
of the 
> license that is included with every copy of SMF, and is therefore
illegal. 
> 
>  As stated in the license: 
> 
>  1. Permission is hereby granted to use, copy, modify and/or
distribute this 
> Package, provided that: 
> 
>     a. All copyright notices within source files and as generated
by the 
> Software as output are retained, unchanged. 
> 
>  2.You may make Modifications to this Package or a derivative of
it, and 
> distribute your Modifications in a form that is separate from the
Package, 
> such as patches. The following restrictions apply to Modifications:

> 
>     a. A Modification must not alter or remove any copyright
notices in the 
> Software or Package, generated or otherwise. 
> 
>  You must now either undo these changes, restoring the original
copyright 
> text or remove all copies of SMF from your server within 48 hours.
The 
> license has already expired, as per section 5: 
> 
>  5. This Agreement will terminate automatically if you fail to
comply with 
> the limitations described herein. 
> 
>  Failure to comply with this notice will result in us contacting
your host 
> and/or other providers to inform them of your illegal activities,
and may 
> require us to involve our lawyers. 
> 
>  If you have any questions regarding this notice or the license,
please 
> contact me or any other team member. The full text of the license
may be 
> viewed at http://www.simple
machines.org/about/license.php 
> 
> -- 
> 
> 
> Michael "Oldiesmann" Eshom 
>  Support Specialist 
>  Simple Machines 
 
 
--  
-kevin

--

Michael "Oldiesmann" Eshom
Support Specialist
Simple Machines

MIME element (text/plain)
